pageContent: Aim: We prospectively investigated health-related quality of life (HR-QOL), including sexual function and sexual bother, in patients who underwent nerve grafting during a radical prostatectomy in comparison with those who underwent a non-nerve-sparing radical prostatectomy.

metaData.source:
[Urinary and sexual disorders following localised prostate cancer management]
